thread.title: Hempfield runner-up in District Three Class AAA girls' team tennis
thread.title_full: Hempfield runner-up in District Three Class AAA girls' team tennis

author: STAFF REPORT | SPORTS@LNPNEWS.COM
title: Hempfield runner-up in District Three Class AAA girls' team tennis
text:
Hempfield runner-up in District Three Class AAA girls' team tennis STAFF REPORT | SPORTS@LNPNEWS.COM Comments Lancaster Newspapers 
Top-seeded Exeter got the better of No. 10 Hempfield in the District Three Class AAA girls’ team tennis championships Thursday, winning 3-0. 
In No. 1 singles at the Hershey Racquet Club, the Eagles’ Ali Snyder downed Amanda Hagino 6-2, 6-0. Exeter went on to sweep the singles, as Sammi Snyder beat Sarah Klag 6-0, 6-3 at No. 2 and Alexis Cramer topped Katie Donnel 7-5, 6-3 at No. 3. 
In Thursday’s Class AAA consolation match, fourth-seeded Manheim Township dropped No. 3 Cumberland Valley 3-0 to advance to PIAA play. 
The Blue Streaks picked up wins at No. 2 and No. 3 singles from Kate Moore and Julia Darkey, respectively. Moore defeated Valerie Motter 6-1, 6-1, while Darkey topped Catherine Miller 6-1, 6-0. At No. 2 doubles, Lizzie McBride and Carolyn Kitsock beat Michaela Svobodova and Juliett Michel, 6-1, 6-0. 
In Class AA play Thursday, top-seeded Berks Catholic took the title on a 3-0 win over Bishop McDevitt. In the consolation match, Wyomissing earned a PIAA bid with a 3-1 win over Pequea Valley. 
The Braves’ lone win came at No. 1 singles, where Lenea Riehl topped Alex Jadic 6-0, 6-4. More Headlines
